title: Improve main-page placement and integration of Recurring Chores

requirements.text: Improve the discoverability and integration of the Recurring Chores feature within the main Tasks page by adding an inline, non-intrusive Recurring Chores section on the Task List view that surfaces a small preview of recurring chores (e.g., grouped by weekday and/or showing the next upcoming items) and provides a clear call-to-action to open the existing Recurring Chores management dialog.

quotes: Can you find a better placement or integration for the recurring chores feature on the main page?

acceptanceCriteria: On the Tasks tab, users can see an inline Recurring Chores section without needing to open a modal first.
The inline section includes a prominent action (button/link) that opens the existing RecurringChoresDialog.
The inline section remains compact and does not visually compete with the primary task list (i.e., does not significantly increase clutter on mobile).
If there are no recurring chores, the inline section shows an empty-state message and a single action to add/manage recurring chores (opening the existing dialog).

requirements.text: Refactor the existing Tasks page header actions so that Recurring Chores is not only a secondary header button; instead, align the action placement with the new inline integration (e.g., demote/remove the header button or change it to a subtle 'Manage' action within the new inline section) while keeping all recurring chore functionality unchanged.

quotes: better placement or integration for the recurring chores feature on the main page

acceptanceCriteria: Recurring chores management remains accessible from the Tasks page via an obvious action in/near the inline Recurring Chores section.
No existing recurring chore capabilities regress (create/edit/assign/delete still work via the dialog).
The Tasks page header remains focused on primary task actions (e.g., Add Task), with reduced competition from secondary actions.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Do not change backend schemas or Motoko logic for this request; this is a UI/UX placement/integration change only.
Keep the existing RecurringChoresDialog functionality and permissions behavior unchanged.
nonGoals: Do not add new recurring chore backend APIs or change recurring chore data models.
Do not redesign the RecurringChoresDialog UI layout beyond what is required for integration/triggering from the Tasks page.
Do not add new tabs/routes/navigation items for recurring chores.
